<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 186, 171, 201]]<|/det|>
# PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 206, 332, 222]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 247, 590, 291]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Multiple Choice Answer Sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 312, 388, 328]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 342, 237, 357]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 357, 504, 372]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 372, 892, 401]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the Answer Sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 383, 415]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 429, 892, 459]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 458, 890, 475]]<|/det|>
Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 488, 556, 504]]<|/det|>
Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 517, 765, 533]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 533, 467, 548]]<|/det|>
Any rough working should be done in this booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 548, 359, 563]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 562, 630, 578]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).

The liquid water boils to form \(1600 \text{cm}^3\) of steam. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 712, 549, 730]]<|/det|> What is the reason for the large increase in volume? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 740, 134, 758]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 740, 571, 758]]<|/det|> Steam molecules are bigger than water molecules. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 767, 134, 785]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 767, 772, 784]]<|/det|> The average distance between the molecules is much greater in the steam. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 794, 134, 811]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 794, 640, 811]]<|/det|> The molecules do not move until the water turns into a gas. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 820, 134, 838]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 820, 705, 838]]<|/det|> There are more steam molecules than there were water molecules.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 186, 107, 203]]<|/det|>
<label>39</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 186, 687, 203]]<|/det|>
An isotope of radon is radioactive. It decays by emitting an \(\alpha\) -particle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 217, 806, 234]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 246, 133, 265]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 246, 761, 265]]<|/det|>
It becomes the nucleus of a different isotope of radon with fewer neutrons.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 272, 133, 291]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 272, 759, 291]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 298, 705, 317]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 325, 133, 344]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 325, 698, 344]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 369, 104, 388]]<|/det|>
<label>40</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 369, 680, 388]]<|/det|>
